sections.heading: Core Function
sections.content: ぞ adds strong masculine emphasis - mainly used by men in casual speech.

sections.heading: Main Use
sections.content:
Strong assertion or determination:

行くぞ！ "Let's go!" / "I'm going!" やるぞ！ "I'll do it!" 見ろぞ！ "Look!" 勝つぞ！ "We'll win!"

sections.heading: Characteristics
sections.content: Masculine/rough tone Shows determination Informal/casual only Can sound aggressive

sections.heading: Usage Context
sections.content:
Appropriate for:

Male friends Sports/competition Action scenes Showing resolve

Avoid with:

Women (sounds too masculine) Superiors Formal situations Polite conversation

sections.heading: Common Patterns
sections.content: [Verb plain form]ぞ 行くぞ - "Let's go!" やるぞ - "I'll do it!" [Statement]だぞ 危ないぞ - "It's dangerous!" 本当だぞ - "It's true!"

sections.heading: Key Takeaways
sections.content:
✓ Strong masculine emphasis ✓ Determination/assertion ✓ Casual/informal only ✓ Mainly male speech ✓ Can sound aggressive

Related:

ぜ (ze) - Casual Emphasis よ (yo) - Emphasis Casual Speech
